a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Income inequality in Latin America, 1981 to 2017
The Gini index measures the distribution of household equivalized income, including zero income. A higher Gini
index is indicative of a more unequal distribution of income.
Source: Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean (CEDLAS and The World Bank)
